BuilderException: Build started, but failure happened during post build operations:
Command '['rpmbuild', '-D', '_sourcedir .', '-D', '_topdir .', '-bs', '/var/tmp/thn-0czv07sv/python-ujson.spec']' returned non-zero exit status 1.

StdOut:
error: Bad source: ./ujson-5.0.0.tar.gz: No such file or directory


Traceback:

  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/hotness/builders/koji.py", line 188, in build

Created attachment 1847055
Update to 5.1.0 (#1862763)
the-new-hotness/release-monitoring.org's scratch build of python-ujson-5.1.0-1.fc34.src.rpm for rawhide failed http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=80235325

Looking at https://github.com/ultrajson/ultrajson/releases, it appears that the only “incompatible” change from 3.x to 4.x was removal of Python 3.5 support, and from 4.x to 5.x was removal of Python 3.6 support. Updating F37 and F36 to the current version from 4.0.2 should therefore be unproblematic.

It even should be possible to update even F34 and F35 to the latest version safely. I don’t have a strong feeling as to whether the bug fixes that would bring are worth the small risk of problems, even after COPR testing.

(In reply to Ben Beasley from comment #32)
> It even should be possible to update even F34 and F35 to the latest version
> safely. I don’t have a strong feeling as to whether the bug fixes that would
> bring are worth the small risk of problems, even after COPR testing.

(Explicitly versioned dependencies on this package are another matter compatibility-wise, and these would have to be carefully checked for.)

I have a PR for version 5.1.0, which I plan to leave open for a week or so to allow for any comments: https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/python-ujson/pull-request/3

I think it makes sense to build it for F37/Rawhide and F36. I’m not sure that further backports are worth the verification effort.
It looks like I’ll need help to merge the PR, since my “collaborator” privileges aren’t configured to include committing to Rawhide. (I’m not sure what, if anything, I can do on this project.)

comments.text: This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
This update has obsoleted [python-fastapi-0.75.0-1.fc36](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-ee9c57e060), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been submitted for testing by bodhi.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.

music edited this update.

New build(s):

- python-fastapi-0.75.0-3.fc36

Removed build(s):

- python-fastapi-0.75.0-2.fc36

Karma has been reset.
This update has been submitted for testing by music.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
Update `python-ujson` to 5.1.0 (compatible with 3.x and 4.x). Loosen version specification in `python-fastapi` to allow the update.

Fixes security bug [CVE-2021-45958](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-45958) ([GHSA-fh56-85cw-5pq6](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fh56-85cw-5pq6)).

-----

**5.1.0**

*Changed*

- Strip debugging symbols from Linux binaries

-----

**5.0.0**

*Added*

- Use cibuildwheel to build wheels

*Removed*

- Drop support for soon-EOL Python 3.6

*Fixed*

- Install Twine to upload to PyPI

-----

**4.3.0**

*Added*

- Enable Windows on ARM64 target

-----

**4.2.0**

*Added*

- Add a default keyword argument to dumps
- Add support for Python 3.10
- Build 32-bit wheels for Windows
- Build PyPy3 wheels for manylinux
- Build wheels for musl aarch64 (aka ARM) Linux (musllinux_1_1_aarch64)
- Build wheels for musl Linux (musllinux_1_1_x86_64)

*Changed*

- Use declarative setup metadata
- Wheel building updates
- Rename master to main
- Replace README.rst with Markdown

-----

**4.1.0**

*Added*

- Add gcov coverage testing for C code
- Test Python 3.10-dev

*Changed*

- Remove unused variable
- Remove explicit handling of manylinux platform tag

*Fixed*

- dconv no longer uses global instances of StringToDoubleConverter and…
- Switch shebang for the manylinux-wheels script
- Fix typos in error message

----

Update to 0.75.0 (close RHBZ#2061006)

## 0.75.0

### Features

* ✨ Add support for custom `generate_unique_id_function` and docs for generating clients. New docs: [Advanced - Generate Clients](https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/advanced/generate-clients/). PR [#4650](https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi/pull/4650) by [@tiangolo](https://github.com/tiangolo).
title: python-fastapi-0.75.0-3.fc36 python-ujson-5.1.0-1.fc36
